content: Folders are subscribed in IMAP accounts. Try right clicking the account in the folder pane and selecting subscribe from the menu.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Never heard of that error before, so I tried google and one of the first things that popped up was one of my least favorite antivirus products. https://forum.kaspersky.com/topic/pr_connect_reset_error-on-firefox-35402/

Yes the issue is Firefox (Thunderbird and Firefox share basically the same code for the connection and network) Most of the fixes for Firefox also work with Thunderbird. Just the user interface to get to the settings is different.

I did have a look here https://cheapsslweb.com/blog/how-to-fix-pr-connect-reset-error-in-firefox and a few other sites with articles mentioning the error and it looks like they have a fairly standard diagnostic process before pointing the finger at the antivirus. 1. Clear the cache. (There is a button for that at the top of the troubleshooting information on the help menu.) 2. Disable security measures – antivirus & firewall (generally here, unless there is some clear reason, we do not suggest disabling Windows defender) 3. Disable and virtual private network(VPN) and proxy 4. Disable addons.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: VERY IMPORTANT CLARIFICATION: The inbox new message double count only appears on the Thunderbird icon on my taskbar tray. That is, the taskbar icon says new 4 messages when only 2 appear in the inbox. The actual inbox message count in the Thunderbird window is OK Thus, this may be a taskbar icon problem.
creator: cvancant

content:
Even stranger! The taskbar icon is double counting only one inbox!

Let me explain. My Thunderbird serves two separate email addresses with their own separate inboxes. If inbox A receives two new messages and inbox B receives one new message, the Thunderbird taskbar tray icon will show (red circle number) 5 new messages. In contrast, if inbox A receives one new message and inbox B receives two, the icon will say 4 new messages. A single new message in A is shown on the icon as two; a single new message in B is shown as one. Clearly, the icon new message counter is double counting only inbox A. Very weird! This selective inbox A double counting happens constantly regardless of the combination and number of new messages for each inbox. This happens in real time as new messages come in. To repeat above, every other aspect of Thunderbird email works perfectly fine and the counts of all folders is correct within the Thunderbird window.

My Thunderbird is kept up-to-date and this double counting has been going on for at least 3 months.
creator: cvancant

content:
Here is my css code for Cards View: 

/* bold sender in cards view */ .thread-card-container :is(.sender){ 	font-weight: bold !important; 	color: blue !important; 	font-size: 15px !important; }  /* unread card sender */ tr[is="thread-card"][data-properties~="unread"] :is(.sender) {       color: black !important;       font-weight: bold !important;       font-size: 15px !important;    }     /* indent card subject */ .thread-card-subject-container :is(.subject){ 	margin-left: 10px !important; 	font-size: 13px !important; 	color: grey !important; }  /* unread card subject */ tr[is="thread-card"][data-properties~="unread"] :is(.subject) {       font-size: 13px !important;       font-weight: bold !important;    }  /* selected card bg color */ html|tr[is="thread-card"].selected {      background-color: lightgreen !important;  }


Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Directory (Win:Folder), close TB, create a new folder named chrome, create a new document in chrome with a text editor, name it userChrome.css, Save as type: All files *.*, copy in the above code, change the numbers and colours as desired. Double-click toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets to true in Settings/General/Config. editor, restart TB.

Online css generator

video on how to create a css file (Firefox and TB)

The code to indent and style the Subject makes it distinct from the sender. Choose colours and fonts to suit your colour scheme.
creator: sfhowes
